entity_name: Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support)
summary: The Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support) was responsible for overseeing security matters, including investigations and operational support. The documents indicate their involvement in approving and managing alias documentation for CIA personnel involved in various operations. This included approving alias documentation for individuals like James P. O'Connell, Harold F. Swenson (under the alias Harold Francis Safley), and Cal William Hitch. They also handled the issuance of CIA identification cards under aliases and approved covert sites for operational use, ensuring security protocols were followed. The documents span from 1961 to 1964, indicating a period of active involvement in these security-related activities.
key_connections: Chief of the Technical Services Division
significance: The Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support) does not appear to be directly related to the JFK assassination based on the provided documents. Their role was primarily focused on managing security protocols, alias documentation, and covert site approvals within the CIA during the early 1960s. The documents suggest a focus on maintaining operational security and providing support for covert activities.
